South Korea's government has announced controversial plans to control the history textbooks used in secondary schools. The government has argued that current history textbooks are too left-leaning and encourage anti-American and pro-North Korea feelings.

A previously unknown US covert program to arm rebels with anti tank weapons had such success that it may have unintentionally drawn Russian forces into the conflict. The program successfully supplied and trained rebels with weapons which caused a "massacre" of Assad's armored units.
